Annotation.note:
Let $ABC$ be an equilateral triangle inscribed in a circle with center $O$, and let $P$ be any point on the circle. Then the Simson line of $P$ (the line through the pedal points of the perpendiculars from $P$ onto the lines passing through pairs of vertices of the triangle) bisects the radius $OP$.
\begin{keywords} geometry theorem proving \end{keywords}
